In MTLK open=1; wep=2; personal=3; enterprise=4; based on encrType (in MAPI 0=open; 1=WEP; 2=TKIP; 3=AES;  =TKIP_AES) and authType (2=RADIUS; 3=PSK)

WPA=1; WPA2=2; mixed=3; mixed restricted=4(not allowed WPA+CCMP or WPA2+TKIP). Since mode 4 is buggy - despite the fact mode 3 is illegal - we are not ommiting mode 3. Requested only when security_mode=3 To recheck in WPS - possible bug there

WPA=1; WPA2=2; mixed=3; mixed restricted=4(not allowed WPA+CCMP or WPA2+TKIP). Since mode 4 is buggy - despite the fact mode 3 is illegal - we are not ommiting mode 3. Requested only when security_mode=3 To recheck in WPS - possible bug there
In MTLK: TKIP=0; CCMP=1; BOTH=2 Requested only when security_mode=4
In MTLK: TKIP=0; CCMP=1; BOTH=2 Requested only when security_mode=3

In UGW there is one set of parameters for all Acs. nAMPDUena defines if the aggregation enabled (?); nAMPDUdir defines the direction: 1=use;2=use and accept; nAMPDUfrms is max number of frames; nBAWsize that is block aknowledge (aggregation?) window size and there are several parameters that define A-MSDU aggregation. Since these are not helpfull (or do they?); we define our own params. To keep investigating.

Driver parameter name is TxPowerLimOpt.
definition:
0. Full Boost on all packets (Warning - This configuration may exceed regulation limits)
1. Full boost on Data packets and no boost on Auto response packets
2. Boost for all Packets, but under regulatory restrictions
3. Boost for Data packet only, but under regulatory restrictions. Auto response packets are not boosted.
4. No Boost
By default, the driver is configured for option "3"

Definition:
0. Beamforming is off
1. Antenna selection is enabled.
2. Explicit beamforming
3. Implicit beamforming
